properties.prefix:
Built Environment


  • There are specific field-sets for recommended aspects of description. The “type” sub-field is used to fine tune the meaning, the “value” sub-field is used to indicate a key-word or phrase for that aspect, and the “note” sub-field is used for a longer text which amplifies the meaning or indicates a special consideration.

  • If there is no specific field-set for your purpose, use “keyword” for typed descriptive words or phrases and “note” for typed descriptive texts.

properties.description: The required name, label or formal title of the building, landscape, etc., being described. This is the primary way of naming the built environment in the system.
properties.title: Primary Title

properties.description: Use this if there are other names or titles associated with the built environment in the context of your research.
properties.title: Alternate Titles

properties.description: The type of alternate title such as Abbreviation or Other Title.
properties.title: Alternate Title Type

properties.description: This is a general description or abstract about what you know about the built environment.
properties.title: Summary Description

properties.description: Keywords, subject terms, key phrases classification codes, etc., ideally drawn from a thesaurus, which classifies or describes the built environment and for which there are no more specific fields in the form.
properties.title: Keywords

properties.description: The type of keyword, such as Subject, Geographic or Temporal. Leaving type blank would imply general keywords.
properties.title: Keyword Type

properties.description: Formal strings of characters that are used to uniquely identify the built environment in various systems. This can also be used to create a formal identifier for the built environment for your project.
properties.title: Identifiers

properties.description: The name of the system or standard for which the identifier was created.
properties.title: Identifier Type

properties.description: A standard identifier for the entity, e.g. ISSN, opus no., etc., or a URI.
properties.title: Identifier

properties.description: Other entities that are related to the built environment, such as the name of a larger built environment of which it is or was a part.
properties.title: Relations

properties.description: Notes pertaining to the relationship being described.
properties.title: Relationship Notes

properties.description: General notes that provide descriptions for other aspects relevant to your understanding of the built environment, and for which there are no more specific fields in the form.
properties.title: Notes

properties.description: The type of note such as Excavation Notes, General Notes, etc.
properties.title: Note Type

properties.description: This can be used to register specific dates associated with the built environment, such as the year it was named, created in its current or a historical form, etc.
properties.title: Time Periods

properties.description: The type of time period such as designed or constructed.
properties.title: Time Period Type

properties.description: A time period name, e.g. "the 20th Century", "Mesozoic Era.
properties.title: Textual Date

properties.description: A specific numeric date or dates associated with the built environment being described.
properties.title: Numeric Dates

properties.description: The type of numeric date such as begin or end date.
properties.title: Date Type

properties.description: A brief note pertaining to the time period being described.
properties.title: Time Period Notes

properties.description: This section can be used to describe the formal geometry of the built environment being described, such as a central point, boundary box or polygon of points that define its boundary.
properties.title: Place Information

properties.description: The type of place being described such as, the current location or creation place.
properties.title: Place Type

properties.description: Name of a geographic location pertaining to the entity being described e.g. Country, Province, Region, etc.
properties.title: Geographic Areas

properties.description: The Geographic Coordinates for the place being described.
properties.title: Geographic Coordinates

properties.description: This is used to identify the time period during which the geometry is relevant to the built environment.
properties.title: Place Time Period

properties.description: The type of date related to the place.
properties.title: Place Date Type

properties.description: A time period name, e.g. "the 20th Century", "Mesozoic Era".
properties.title: Textual Date

properties.description: A specific numeric date or dates associated with the place being described.
properties.title: Numeric Date

properties.description: The type of numeric date.
properties.title: Date Type

properties.description: A brief note pertaining to the place being described.
properties.title: Place Notes

properties.description: This is used to identify people or organizations that have a special relationship to the built environment. For example, the person who designed or first defined it, or an organization that sponsored exploration of it.
properties.title: Related People and Organizations

properties.description: The role of the person related to the built environment, such as “founder ” or “explorer”.
properties.title: Role

properties.description: The name of the person.
properties.title: Person Name

properties.description: The role of the organization related to the built environment, such as "owner" or "commissioner".
properties.title: Role

properties.description: The name of the organization.
properties.title: Organization Name

properties.description: This is used to classify and/or describe the physical characteristics of a built environment.
properties.title: Physical Description

properties.description: The type of physical item being described.
properties.title: Physical Description Type

properties.description: Notes pertaining to the physical description.
properties.title: Physical Description Notes

properties.description: Currently observed state of the built environment being described.
properties.title: Condition

properties.description: The type of Condition that is being described.
properties.title: Condition Type

properties.description: Brief text describing the condition.
properties.title: Condition

properties.description: Notes pertaining to the condition.
properties.title: Condition Notes

properties.description: This is used to describe the physical surroundings or meaning of a built environment, such as its religious or historical context.
properties.title: Context

properties.description: The type of Context being described such as Cultural, Religious, etc.
properties.title: Context Type

properties.description: Brief text describing the context.
properties.title: Context

properties.description: Notes pertaining to the context.
properties.title: Context Notes

properties.description: Describes the techniques used in the making of a built environment.
properties.title: Techniques

properties.description: The type of technique used.
properties.title: Technique Type

properties.description: Brief text describing the technique.
properties.title: Technique

properties.description: Notes pertaining to the Technique being described.
properties.title: Technique Notes

properties.description: An enhancement, adjustment or preparation of the built environment being described.
properties.title: Treatments

properties.description: The type of treatment being described.
properties.title: Treatment Type

properties.description: Brief text describing the treatment.
properties.title: Treatment

properties.description: Notes pertaining to the treatment being described.
properties.title: Treatment Notes

properties.description: Either a textual or formal numeric description of the dimensions of a built environment, such as area in hectares, size in square feet, etc.
properties.title: Measurements

properties.description: This is for cases where the measurements are just a string of text. For example, L 15' x W 3'.
properties.title: Measurement

properties.description: A measurement intended to be a single dimension using a combination of the type, value and units attributes.
properties.title: Numeric Measurements

properties.description: The type of measurement such as height, depth, circumference or number of components.
properties.title: Measurement Type

properties.description: The value of the measurement.
properties.title: Measurement Value

properties.description: The unit of measurement such as feet, meters, inches or centimeters.
properties.title: Measurement Unit

properties.description: The dates pertaining to a measurement.
properties.title: Measurement Dates

properties.description: A textual date such as a time period name, e.g. "the 20th Century" or "the Mesazoic era".
properties.title: Textual Date

properties.description: A numeric date associated with the measurement being described.
properties.title: Numeric Dates

properties.description: The type of numeric date such as Begin or End date.
properties.title: Date Type

properties.description: Explanatory text on the accuracy of the set of measurements.
properties.title: Measurement Accuracy

properties.description: Notes pertaining to the set of measurements.
properties.title: Measurement Notes
